body_html:
I found the bug. I'll have a patch out soon.

In some configurations where we stage the intermediate results in global memory the allocated buffer isn't large enough. The kernel then writes past the end of the buffer which can cause all sorts of bad behavior depending on where it lies.
body_text:
I found the bug. I'll have a patch out soon.
In some configurations where we stage the intermediate results in global memory the allocated buffer isn't large enough. The kernel then writes past the end of the buffer which can cause all sorts of bad behavior depending on where it lies.
body:
I found the bug. I'll have a patch out soon.

In some configurations where we stage the intermediate results in global memory the allocated buffer isn't large enough. The kernel then writes past the end of the buffer which can cause all sorts of bad behavior depending on where it lies.
